narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1942Q1
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q1.
narrative.objectives: Elite British-Indian infantry division in transitional period. Division returned from East Africa to North Africa in February 1942, briefly stationed at Gazala Line preparing defenses. Not engaged in major combat operations during Q1 1942. Division dispersed in April 1942 with brigades sent to different theaters (Cyprus, Syria, Suez) for garrison and security duties. Reunited later in 1942 for El Alamein campaign.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal plain at Gazala Line (February-March), mixed deployment after dispersal

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Veteran division with extensive combat experience from Operation Compass and East Africa
Mixed British and Indian battalions providing tactical flexibility
Experienced in reducing fortified positions (Tobruk, Keren, Halfaya)
High morale from previous battlefield successes ('Red Eagles' reputation)

environment.terrain_type: coastal plain at Gazala Line (February-March), mixed deployment after dispersal
